prompt: left side fibrinolysis note. dose #4. 58yo F. inserted tube on 10/13/25. ref by Dr. Miller.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 10/18/25 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Miller

INDICATION FOR OPERATION The patient is a 58-year-old female who presents with a loculated pleural effusion.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to the instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial) were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient indicated a wish to proceed with the procedure and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Pleural Effusion

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Pleural Effusion

PROCEDURE

Instillation of fibrinolytic agent (tPA/DNase) via chest tube (CPT 32561).
ATTENDING Dr. H. Reynolds

SUPPORT STAFF RN: David, RN

COMPLICATIONS None

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL The patient was assessed, and the existing left-sided chest tube (inserted on 10/13/25) was identified and checked for patency.
Intrapleural Fibrinolysis Application A solution containing 10 mg of tPA and 5 mg of DNase was prepared.
The area surrounding the chest tube was prepped. The lytic agents were instilled through the chest tube into the pleural space.
This marked Dose #4 of the therapy regimen.

Following instillation, the tube was clamped to allow the medication to dwell according to protocol.
The patient was instructed to rotate positions to facilitate distribution of the agent.
IMPRESSION / PLAN

58-year-old female successfully underwent instillation of fibrinolytic agents (tPA/DNase) for pleural effusion.
The patient tolerated the procedure well.

There were no immediate complications.

Disposition: Home.

prompt: CPT 32561 Instillation of fibrinolytic agent. Dx: pleural effusion. Side: left. Dose: 5. Attending: Dr. K. O'Malley.

Following instillation, the tube was clamped to allow the medication to dwell according to protocol.
The patient was instructed to rotate positions to facilitate distribution of the agent.
IMPRESSION / PLAN

41-year-old male successfully underwent instillation of fibrinolytic agents (tPA/DNase) for complicated effusion.
The patient tolerated the procedure well.

There were no immediate complications.

Disposition: Home.
